DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects events from the following InstaGate devices: Firewall models 404, 404e, 604, 806, and ThreatWall models 250, 450, and 650.

file.toolTipText: Directory or path to read from

string.toolTipText: Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

integer.toolTipText: Number of seconds between log reads

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? [-\w]+ PF \w+ [A-Z]+: IN=\S* OUT=\S* MAC=[a-f\d:]* SRC=[\d.]+ DST=[\d.]+ LEN=\d+ TOS=0x[A-F\d]{2} PREC=0x[A-F\d]{2} TTL=\d+ ID=\d+ \w* ?PROTO=TCP SPT=\d+ DPT=\d+

FastFormatter.format: Len: $11, Tos: $12, Prec: $13, TTL: $14, ID: $15, Window: $22, Flags: $23, Urgp: $24

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? [-\w]+ PF \w+ [A-Z]+: IN=\S* OUT=\S* MAC=[a-f\d:]* SRC=[\d.]+ DST=[\d.]+ LEN=\d+ TOS=0x[A-F\d]{2} PREC=0x[A-F\d]{2} TTL=\d+ ID=\d+ \w* ?PROTO=UDP SPT=\d+ DPT=\d+

FastFormatter.format: Len: $11, Tos: $12, Prec: $13, TTL: $14, ID: $15, Window: $22, Flags: $23, Urgp: $24

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? [-\w]+ PF \w+ [A-Z]+: IN=\S* OUT=\S* MAC=[a-f\d:]* SRC=[\d.]+ DST=[\d.]+ LEN=\d+ TOS=0x[A-F\d]{2} PREC=0x[A-F\d]{2} TTL=\d+ ID=\d+ \w* ?PROTO=[-\w]+ SPT=\d+ DPT=\d+

FastFormatter.format: Len: $11, Tos: $12, Prec: $13, TTL: $14, ID: $15, Window: $22, Flags: $23, Urgp: $24

FastPattern.description: 11, Ex, MailTrafficAudit: rejected after data, temp

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2} SMTP command timeout on connection from [-\w.() ]* ?\[[\d.]+\]

FastPattern.matcher: ^(\d+) ([-\w.]+).*? \d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2} unexpected disconnection while reading SMTP command from ([-\w.()]*) ?\[([\d.]+)\]\s*.*
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2} unexpected disconnection while reading SMTP command from [-\w.()]* ?\[[\d.]+\]

FastField.defaultValue: Unexpected disconnection while reading SMTP command

FastPattern.description: 27, Ex, ServiceInfo: Greylisting; ctasd reports; DKIM:
29, Ex, MailTrafficAudit: Connection refused; Connection timed out

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2} \S+ Malformed SMTP reply from \S+ \[[\d.]+\] in response to pipelined DATA

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: dpid; scan result okay
26, Tw, MailTrafficAudit: dpid; scan result not okay
28, Tw, NamingTrafficAudit: named; points to cname

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: spamd: server hit by SIGHUP, restarting

FastPattern.description: 33, Tw, ServiceStart: spamd; started on socket
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: spamd: server started on \w+ domain socket \S+ \(running version [\d.]+\)
^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ SubscriptionUpdate\[\d+\]: New backend process SubscriptionUpdate spawned as pid \d+\.

FastPattern.description: 38, Tw, ServiceWarning: named; no default TTL
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ named\[\d+\]: Zone "[-\w.]+" \(file .+?\): No default TTL \(\$TTL <value>\) set

FastFormatter.format: No default TTL set for zone "$7"

FastPattern.description: 39, Tw, ServiceWarning: QuarantineNotices; access not enabled
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ QuarantineNotices\[\d+\]: quarantine access not enabled for '.+'

FastPattern.description: 40, Tw, ServiceWarning: sysAVUpdate; events av update failure
41, Tw, ServiceWarning: sysQuarantine; unable to open
42, Tw, ServiceWarning: sysQuarantineIndexer; could not find
43, Tw, ServiceWarning: spamd; bayes, estimation method
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: can't use estimation method for expiry

FastPattern.description: 44, Tw, ServiceWarning: spamd; dcc, dccifd not available
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dcc: dccifd is not available:

FastPattern.description: 45, Tw, ServiceWarning: spamd; dns, resolver not available
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: is Net::DNS::Resolver available\? no\s*
^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: timeout for \S+ after \d+ seconds

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, cannot trust envelope-from
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: message: X-Envelope-From header found after \d+ or more Received lines, cannot trust envelope-from

FastPattern.description: 48, Tw, ServiceWarning: spamd; rules, meta test dependency

FastFormatter.format: rules meta test has a undefined dependency

FastFormatter.condition: meta test \w+ has dependency '(.+)' with a zero score.*
FastFormatter.format: rules meta test has a dependency with a zero score

FastPattern.description: 49, Tw, ServiceWarning: spamd; util, time error
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: util: (\w+) after supported range, forcing \1 to \w+:

FastPattern.description: 50, Tw, ServiceWarning: spamd; util, time parse
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: util: time cannot be parsed:

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: dmnBackEnd; Sudo SpamFilterBayes verify
Tw, NullAlert: dmnBackEnd; Sudo SpamFilterBayes spam/ham

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ diald\[\d+\]: IP transmitted \d+ bytes and received \d+ bytes

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: dmnBackEnd; received valid sudo command
Tw, NullAlert: dmnBackEnd; received command catchall
55, Tw, ServiceInfo: named; forwarding source address

FastFormatter.format: Forwarding source address is: IP Address: $7, Port: $8
listening on: IP Address: $7, Port: $8, Interface: $9

FastPattern.description: 57, Tw, ServiceInfo: named; ready to answer queries
Tw, NullAlert: PHP_menu; fork sent sudo
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, already learnt
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: \S+ already learnt correctly, not learning twice

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, atime token reduction
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, bayes journal sync
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, corpus size
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: corpus size: nspam = \d+, nham = \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, db expiry
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: DB expiry: tokens in DB: \d+, Expiry max size: \d+, Oldest atime: \d+, Newest atime: \d+, Last expire: \d+, Current time: \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, db journal sync
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: DB journal sync: last sync: \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, db version
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: found bayes db version [\d.]+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, expired old bayes
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: expired old bayes database entries in \d+ seconds: \d+ entries kept, \d+ deleted

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, expiry check
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: expiry check keep size, [\d.]+ \* max: \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, expiry completed/starting
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, expiry max exponent
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, files locked
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: files locked, now unlocking lock

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, first pass
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: first pass\? current: \d+, Last: \d+, atime: \d+, count: \d+, newdelta: \d+, ratio: [\d.]+, period: \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, first pass decided
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: first pass decided on \d+ for atime delta

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, opportunistic call found
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: opportunistic call found .+ due

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, opportunistic call skipped
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: opportunistic call attempt skipped, found fresh running expire magic token

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, synced from journal
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: synced databases from journal in \d+ seconds: \d+ unique entries \(\d+ total entries\)

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, tie-ing to db file
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: tie-ing to DB file R/[OW] \S+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, token count
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: bayes: token count: \d+, final goal reduction size: \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; bayes, two numbers
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; check, is spam
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; check, tests for priority
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: check: running tests for priority: \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; config, adding redirector regex
60, Tw, ServiceInfo: spamd; config, conf backup
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: config: copying current conf (?:from|to) backup

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; config, read file
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; config, score set chosen
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; config, rules dir
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: config: using "\S+" for (?:default|site) rules dir

FastPattern.description: 61, Tw, ServiceInfo: spamd; config, rules pre files
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: config: using "\S+" for (?:site|sys) rules pre files

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dcc, dccproc available
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dcc, got response
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dcc, opening pipe
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dcc, tests on
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dcc: network tests on, registering DCC
^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: is Net::DNS::Resolver available\? yes

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, checking A and MX
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: checking A and MX for [-\w.]+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, checking RBL

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: dns_available set to yes in config file, skipping test

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, ip is private
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: IP is private, not looking up PTR: [\d.]+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, ips found
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: IPs found: full-external: .+ untrusted: .+ originating:

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, launching query
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: launching DNS (?:A|MX|TXT) query for [-\w.]+ in background

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, looking up ptr
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: looking up PTR record for '[-\w.]+'

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, name server
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, only inspecting
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: only inspecting the following IPs:

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; dns, ptr for

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: dns: success for \d+ of \d+ queries

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; eval, all addrs
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; eval, date chosen
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: eval: date chosen from message:

FastFormatter.condition: forged-HELO: massive mismatch on IP-addr HELO:.*
FastFormatter.format: forged-HELO, massive mismatch on IP-addr HELO

FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: eval: madiff: left: \d+, orig: \d+, max-difference: [\d.]+%

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; eval, round-the-world probably not
64, Tw, ServiceInfo: spamd; eval, round-the-world mail relayed
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: eval: round-the-world: mail relayed through [-\w.]+ by [-\w.]+ \(.+\)

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; eval, text words
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: eval: text words: \d+, html words: \d+

FastPattern.description: 65, Tw, NulAlert: spamd; eval, time_t from date
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; eval, trying header date
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: eval: trying Received header date for real time:

FastPattern.description: 66, Tw, ServiceInfo: spamd; generic, SpamAssassin version
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; learn, learning pork
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; learn, message score
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: learn: auto-learn: message score: -?\d+\.?[-e\d]*, computed score for autolearn: -?\d+\.?[-e\d]*

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; learn, not pork
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: learn: auto-learn\? no: inside auto-learn thresholds, not considered ham or spam

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; learn, scored as
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: learn: auto-learn\? no: scored as
^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: learn: auto-learn: currently using scoreset \d+, recomputing score based on scoreset \d+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, added part
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, decoding base64
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, decoding quoted-printable
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, decoding other
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: message: decoding other encoding type \(\w+\), ignoring

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, found part
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: message: found part of type [-/\w]+, boundary: .+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, main type
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, no encoding
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, parsing multipart
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: message: parsing multipart, got boundary: .+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, parsing normal part
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; message, parser start/end
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; rules, address match
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: rules: address \S+@[-\w.]+ matches whitelist or blacklist regexp: .+

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; rules, ran rule
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: rules: ran (?:eval|header|rawbody|body|uri) rule \w+ =+> got hit

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; rules, running tests
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: rules: running (?:body-text|full-text|header|meta|raw-body-text) (?:per-line )?(?:regexp )?tests; score so far=-?\d+[-e\d.]*

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: spamd; uri, running tests
FastPattern.pattern: ^\d+ [-\w.]+.*? \d{4} \w{3} \d{2} [\d:]{8} [-\w]+ spamd\[\d+\]: uri: running uri tests; score so far=-?\d+[-e\d.]*

FastPattern.description: Tw, NullAlert: SubscriptionUpdate; berkeley db3 support
Tw, NullAlert: SubscriptionUpdate; func call (long params)
Tw, NullAlert: SubscriptionUpdate; exp, spd, diff
Tw, NullAlert: sysQuarantine; repository aging begin/end
Tw, NullAlert: sysQuarantine; repository aging days
Tw, NullAlert: spamd; rules, dangling quote
